stepTitle: Ernest Rutherford (the first New Zealander to be awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry) demonstrated that nuclei were very small and dense by scattering helium-4 nuclei (4He) from gold-197 nuclei (197Au). the energy of the incoming helium nucleus was 8.00×10**-13 J, and the masses of the helium and gold nuclei were 6.68×10**-27 kg and 3.29×10**-25 kg, respectively (note that their mass ratio is $$4$$ to 197). If a helium nucleus scatters to an angle of 120º during an elastic collision with a gold nucleus, calculate the helium nucleus’s final speed and the final velocity (magnitude and direction) of the gold nucleus.
